overview_of_class: Through lectures, reading assignments, discussions, in-class screenings, and in-class workshops, this course provides a supportive environment where students are encouraged to take risks and experiment as they discover their narrative voice. Students will have opportunities to work both individually and primarily, collaboratively, in small groups. Students will be introduced to the technical and theoretical components necessary for media construction: narrative, sound, image, and editing. Projects will include audio and video assignments and will culminate in the production of group short films.
name: Media Construction
subject: RTVF

overview_of_class: This course introduces students to technical, aesthetic, and theoretical components of media construction, including narrative, sound, image, and editing. Through lectures, assignments, in-class screenings, discussions, and accompanying technical lab sessions, students will gain a good understanding of the fundamentals of filmmaking. Students will work on both group and individual projects.
